qas.question: What suggests that the last few million years featured the greatest biodiversity in history?
Why are some scientists uncertain about the fossil record?

answers.text: how strongly the fossil record is biased by the greater availability and preservation of recent geologic sections.

qas.question: Why are some scientists uncertain about the diversification of life?
What is the time estimate variation of the present global fossils?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>The fossil record<b4_0/><a0_0/> suggests that the last few million years featured the greatest biodiversity in history. However, not all scientists support this view, since there is uncertainty as to <a1_0><b5_0>how strongly the fossil record is biased by the greater availability and preservation of recent geologic sections<b5_0/>.<a1_0/> Some scientists believe that corrected for sampling artifacts, <b8_0>modern biodiversity<b8_0/> may not be much different from biodiversity 300 million years ago., whereas others consider the fossil record reasonably reflective of the diversification of life. Estimates of the present global macroscopic species diversity vary <a2_0>from <b6_0>2 million to 100 million<b6_0/><a2_0/>, with a best estimate of somewhere near 9 million, the vast majority arthropods. <a3_0><b7_0>Diversity<b7_0/><a3_0/> appears to increase continually in the absence of natural selection.
